recipes.name: Paneer Butter Masala
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add finely chopped onions. Sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Blend the mixture to a smooth paste using a blender.
Return the paste to the pan and add butter. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and cook for 5 minutes on low heat.
Add garam masala and cream. Mix well and cook for 2 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

recipes.name: Thai Red Curry with Tofu
instructions: Press tofu to remove excess water and cut into cubes.
Heat oil in a wok and fry tofu until golden brown. Set aside.
In the same wok, add red curry paste and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add bell peppers and bamboo shoots. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
Add fried tofu and cook for 2 minutes.
Season with fish sauce, palm sugar, and lime juice.
Garnish with Thai basil and serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Quinoa Vegetable Stir Fry
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package instructions and set aside.
Heat sesame oil in a large wok over high heat.
Add minced ginger and garlic, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add chopped vegetables (broccoli, carrot, bell pepper) and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add cooked quinoa and soy sauce. Mix well.
Cook for 2-3 minutes until everything is well combined.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve hot.

recipes.name: Dal Makhani
instructions: Soak black lentils and kidney beans overnight or for 6 hours.
Pressure cook lentils and beans with salt and turmeric until soft.
Heat oil in a pan and add finely chopped onions. Sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add red chili powder and cook for 1 minute.
Add cooked lentils and beans. Mix well and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add butter, cream, and garam masala. Cook for 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Vegetable Biryani
instructions: Soak basmati rice for 30 minutes and saffron in warm milk.
Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan and add whole spices.
Add sliced onions and cook until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add mixed vegetables and biryani masala. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add soaked rice and saffron milk. Mix gently.
Add water (1:1.5 ratio) and bring to boil.
Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes until rice is done.
Garnish with mint and coriander leaves. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Chickpea Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them crackle.
Add finely chopped onions and cook until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add cooked chickpeas and mix well.
Add water and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add garam masala and cook for 2 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice or bread.

recipes.name: Mushroom Masala
instructions: Clean and slice mushrooms. Keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan and add finely chopped onions.
Sauté until onions become translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add garam masala and cook for 2 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

recipes.name: Spinach and Paneer Curry
instructions: Blanch spinach in hot water for 2 minutes and blend to a smooth paste.
Heat oil in a pan and add finely chopped onions.
Sauté until onions become golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add spinach paste and cook for 5 minutes.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Add paneer cubes and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Add garam masala and cream. Mix well.
Cook for 2 minutes and serve hot with rice or roti.

recipes.name: Vegetable Stir Fry
instructions: Cut all vegetables into similar-sized pieces.
Heat sesame oil in a wok over high heat.
Add minced ginger and garlic, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add vegetables starting with the hardest ones (carrots, broccoli).
Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, then add softer vegetables.
Add soy sauce and continue stir-frying for 2-3 minutes.
Vegetables should be crisp-tender, not mushy.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Lentil Soup
instructions: Rinse red lentils thoroughly and set aside.
Heat oil in a pot and add cumin seeds. Let them crackle.
Add finely chopped onions and cook until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add chopped carrots and cook for 2 minutes.
Add lentils, turmeric powder, and salt.
Add water and bring to boil. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Blend partially for a creamy texture.
Garnish with coriander leaves and lemon juice. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Kanda Poha
instructions: Rinse poha in water and drain. Keep aside for 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds. Let them crackle.
Add curry leaves and green chili. Sauté for 30 seconds.
Add chopped onions and potatoes. Cook until soft.
Add peas and turmeric powder. Mix well.
Add poha and salt. Mix gently and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Squeeze lemon juice and garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot.
